original: gnyis dang bral ba /
analyzed: gnyis dang bral ba /

original: rtog pa dang sel ba las shin tu 'das pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang sel ba las shin tu 'das pa /

original: dus las lta ba /
analyzed: dus las lta ba /

original: dus las ma yol ba /
analyzed: dus las ma yol ba /
translated: not beyond time,

original: mi g-yo ba /🔽rlom sems med pa /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba / rlom sems med pa /

original: ma brtags pa /🔽rnam par ma brtags pa /
analyzed: ma brtags pa / rnam par ma brtags pa /
translated: unperceived,🔽unperceived in all aspects,

original: ma bsgoms pa /
analyzed: ma bsgoms pa /

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: not revealed,

original: yang dag pa de kho na /
analyzed: yang dag pa de kho na /

original: de bzhin nyid /🔽ma nor ba de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid /
translated: suchness,🔽unmistaken suchness,

analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid de / sh'a ri'i bu; de bzhin gshegs pa ni /

original: de lta bu'i btang snyoms phun sum tshogs pas sems can thams cad btang snyoms yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /🔽sh'a ri'i bu; 'di ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i btang snyoms phun sum tshogs pas sems can thams cad btang snyoms yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston te / sh'a ri'i bu; 'di ni /
translated: Śāriputra, the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma so that all beings may perfect such a complete equanimity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa drug pa'o //🔽gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa drug pa'o // gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra, the Tathāgata has no loss of aspiration.

original: de la 'dun pa gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'dun pa gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is aspiration?

original: @130a *// dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: @130a *// dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa'o //
translated: It is aspiration for virtuous qualities.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
translated: He has no loss of aspiration for the Tathāgata Maitreya.

original: snying rje chen po la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: snying rje chen po la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
translated: He has no loss of aspiration for great compassion.

original: chos ston pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: chos ston pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
translated: He has no loss of aspiration for teaching the Dharma.

original: sems can 'dul ba la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: sems can 'dul ba la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
translated: He has no loss of aspiration for training sentient beings.

original: rab tu dben pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
translated: He has no loss of aspiration for solitude.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'dzud pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'dzud pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
translated: He has no loss of aspiration for introducing bodhisattvas.

original: dkon mchog gsum rgyun mi gcod pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum rgyun mi gcod pa la 'dun pa nyams pa med do //
translated: He has no loss of aspiration for not interrupting the lineage of the Three Jewels.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata

original: 'dun pas 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dun pas 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
translated: does not go by aspiration,

original: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: but by the priority of wisdom.

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'dun pa'o //
translated: This is the aspiration of the Tathāgata.

original: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i thams cad mkhyen par 'dun pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bla na med pa'i thams cad mkhyen par 'dun pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma in order to perfect the aspiration for unsurpassed omniscience in all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh of the buddhadharmas.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtson 'grus nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtson 'grus nyams pa med do //
translated: The Tathāgata’s effort is never impaired.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtson 'grus 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtson 'grus 'di lta ste /
translated: The Tathāgata’s effort is as follows:

original: 'dul ba'i sems can la yal bar mi 'dor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / chos nyan pa la brnyas pa med pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i sems can la yal bar mi 'dor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / chos nyan pa la brnyas pa med pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: He is not indifferent to sentient beings who are to be disciplined, and he is not contemptuous of those who listen to the Dharma.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi sde snod nyan pa gang bskal par nyan kyang skyo bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu brnyes na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi sde snod nyan pa gang bskal par nyan kyang skyo bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu brnyes na /
translated: If the Tathāgata were to find someone who would listen to the basket of the Dharma for an eon, he would not be discouraged.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang chos ston cing zhal zas dang @130b bral ba'i rgyud kyis bskal par yang mi bzhengs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang chos ston cing zhal zas dang @130b bral ba'i rgyud kyis bskal par yang mi bzhengs so //
translated: The Tathāgata would teach the Dharma for an eon, without rising from his seat, in order to nourish that person with the food of the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can la blta bas tha na gang na sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gcig gi phyir yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed 'da' zhing bzhud de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can la blta bas tha na gang na sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can gcig gi phyir yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed 'da' zhing bzhud de /
translated: The Tathāgata, looking at sentient beings, would cross as many buddhafields as there are sands in the Ganges river for the sake of a single sentient being who is to be disciplined by a buddha, even if that sentient being were at the end of the world system.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la lus ngal ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la lus ngal ba'am /
translated: The Tathāgata would not be physically tired,

original: ngag ngal ba'am /
analyzed: ngag ngal ba'am /
translated: nor would he be verbally tired,

original: sems ngal ba med do //
analyzed: sems ngal ba med do //
translated: His mind is never tired.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /🔽lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni / lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa'o //
translated: has a body and mind that are very pliable.

original: brtson 'grus kyi bsngags pa gsung pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi bsngags pa gsung pa ste /
translated: He praises the practice of effort.

original: brtson 'grus kyis yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba gang gis sems can la 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus de sems can rnams la bsngags par mdzad de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis yang dag par rab tu sbyor ba gang gis sems can la 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ba'i brtson 'grus de sems can rnams la bsngags par mdzad de /
translated: He praises the effort by which beings attain the noble liberation of mind.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: this is the eighth of the Tathāgata’s unique qualities of a buddha.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: the Tathāgata

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du dran pa nyams pa med cing /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du dran pa nyams pa med cing /
translated: never has any loss of recollection in any respect whatsoever.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata’s recollection

original: bsnyel ba med do //
analyzed: bsnyel ba med do //
translated: is never confused.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud la rnam par bltas kyang de la de bzhin gshegs pa la phyis shin tu dran pa bsnyel ba med do //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud la rnam par bltas kyang de la de bzhin gshegs pa la phyis shin tu dran pa bsnyel ba med do //
translated: As soon as the Tathagata fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, he looks at the mind-streams of sentient beings in the past, future, and present, and the Tathagata's later mindfulness with regard to that is never lost.

original: @131a *// sems can gyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes kyang de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes phyis gtang bar bya ba med do //
analyzed: @131a *// sems can gyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes kyang de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes phyis gtang bar bya ba med do //
translated: Even though he knows sentient beings' conduct just as it is, the Tathagata's later wisdom with regard to that is never lost.

original: phung po gsum du rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi bsam par 'jug pa la sems kyi spyod pa rnam par lta bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa la yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: phung po gsum du rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po la 'jug pa dang / sems can gyi bsam par 'jug pa la sems kyi spyod pa rnam par lta bas de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa la yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: The Tathagata's mindfulness is never lost through looking at the conduct of the mind with regard to the arrangement into three aggregates, engaging the faculties of sentient beings, and engaging the thoughts of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dran pa ni /
translated: The Tathagata's mindfulness is never lost.

original: dran par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba dang / brtag par bya ba med kyang sems can rnams la chos ston pa 'bri bar mi 'gyur ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dran par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba dang / brtag par bya ba med kyang sems can rnams la chos ston pa 'bri bar mi 'gyur ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de'i dran pa la nyams pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i dran pa la nyams pa med do //
translated: Because his mindfulness is never impaired.

original: de ji ltar dran pas bdag dran cing mi brjed pa de bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: de ji ltar dran pas bdag dran cing mi brjed pa de bzhin du sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: Just as he himself is mindful and does not forget, in the same way he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dgu pa'o //
translated: This, Śāriputra, is the Tathāgata’s ninth unique quality of a buddha.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med do //
translated: the Tathāgata’s samādhi is never impaired.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de ni /
translated: The Tathāgata’s samādhi

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: is the sameness of all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad mi mnyam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi mnyam pa ma yin no //
translated: All dharmas are not different.

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: All dharmas

original: ji lta ba bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin pa'o //
translated: are just as they are.

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin las mi nyams she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin las mi nyams she na /
translated: And why is it that the Tathāgata’s samādhi is never impaired?

original: de bzhin nyid gang dang mnyam pa ting nge 'dzin kyang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang dang mnyam pa ting nge 'dzin kyang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: The sameness of suchness is the sameness of meditative absorption.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang dang mnyam pa de bzhin nyid kyang de @131b dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang dang mnyam pa de bzhin nyid kyang de @131b dang mnyam ste /
translated: The sameness of meditative absorption is the sameness of suchness.

original: mnyam pa nyid de la zhugs pas de'i phyir mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de la zhugs pas de'i phyir mnyam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they have entered this sameness, it is called sameness.

original: 'dod chags kyi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa 'dod chags med pa'i mtha' yang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa 'dod chags med pa'i mtha' yang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: The limit of desire is the same as the limit of the absence of desire.

original: zhe sdang gi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa zhe sdang med pa'i mtha' yang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa zhe sdang med pa'i mtha' yang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: The limit of anger is the same as the limit of the absence of anger.

original: gti mug gi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa gti mug med pa'i mtha' yang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: gti mug gi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa gti mug med pa'i mtha' yang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: The limit of delusion is the same as the limit of the absence of delusion.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa 'dus ma byas kyi mtha' yas de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtha' gang dang mnyam pa 'dus ma byas kyi mtha' yas de dang mnyam mo //
translated: The limit of the conditioned is the same as the limit of the unconditioned.

original: 'khor ba'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' yang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtha' gang dang mnyam pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' yang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: The limit of saṃsāra is the same as the limit of nirvāṇa.

original: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med ces bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med ces bya'o //
translated: Because he is absorbed in that sameness, the sameness of all dharmas, therefore the sameness of the Tathāgata’s meditative absorption is said to be unimpaired.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽mnyam pa nyid las mi nyams /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / mnyam pa nyid las mi nyams /
translated: Why is that?

original: yongs su mi nyams so //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams so //
translated: Because he does not fall away from sameness,🔽he does not fall away from the Tathāgata’s meditative absorption.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de yang mig dang ldan pa ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de yang mig dang ldan pa ma yin /
translated: Moreover, that meditative absorption of the Tathāgata is not associated with the eye,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang ldan pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang ldan pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: nor is it associated with the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po mtshang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po mtshang ba ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not one who is deficient in faculties.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: Meditative absorption

original: sa'i khams la mi gnas /
analyzed: sa'i khams la mi gnas /
translated: does not rest in the earth element,

original: chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams la mi gnas /
analyzed: chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams la mi gnas /
translated: nor does it rest in the water, fire, or wind elements.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams la mi gnas /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams la mi gnas /
translated: It does not rest in the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la mi gnas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la mi gnas te /
translated: It does not rest in the other world.

original: mi gnas pas na nyams pa med do //
analyzed: mi gnas pas na nyams pa med do //
translated: Since it does not rest, it is unimpaired.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyams pa @132a *//
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyams pa @132a *//
translated: Therefore the Tathāgata’s meditative absorption is said to be unimpaired.

original: med do; ;sems can thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnyed par bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: med do; ;sems can thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnyed par bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: “All sentient beings teach the Dharma in order to attain the samādhi of the tathāgatas.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcu pa'o //
translated: this is the tenth tathāgata activity of the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab nyams pa med do //
translated: the wisdom of the tathāgatas is unimpaired.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab gang zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab gang zhe na /
translated: What is the wisdom of the tathāgatas?

original: gang chos thams cad rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge of all phenomena.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that is not dependent on others.

original: sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag la chos go bar byed pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag la chos go bar byed pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that teaches the Dharma to other sentient beings and other individuals.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa la mkhas pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa mi zad pa la mkhas pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that is skilled in the imperishability of the discernments.

original: tshig thams cad rab tu dbye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshig thams cad rab tu dbye ba shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the distinctions of all words.

original: tshig gcig la 'jug pas bskal pa brgya stong du mi chad par ston par shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig la 'jug pas bskal pa brgya stong du mi chad par ston par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that teaches without interruption for many hundreds of thousands of eons through engaging in a single word.

original: ji lta bu ci 'dra zhes dris pa ji lta ba bzhin du the tshom gcod pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu ci 'dra zhes dris pa ji lta ba bzhin du the tshom gcod pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that resolves doubts, just as they are asked.

original: thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that is unimpeded in all things.

original: theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa bstan pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum rnam par dgod pa bstan pa shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that teaches the arrangement of the three vehicles.

original: sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong yongs su shes pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong yongs su shes pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that understands the eighty-four thousand mental behaviors of sentient beings.

original: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ci rigs par yang dag par rab tu ston par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ci rigs par yang dag par rab tu ston par shes pa'o //

analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /

analyzed: gzhon nu / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can mthong na /
translated: “Moreover, young man, when bodhisattvas see beings who delight in saṃsāra,

translated: I will teach them the Dharma so that they may be completely liberated from the five aggregates, which are like murderers, so that they may completely transcend the wilderness of saṃsāra, and so that they may be freed from the entire three realms.”

original: zhes sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Thus, young man, the bodhisattvas’ great compassion extends to all sentient beings.

analyzed: gzhon nu / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas sems can 'khrugs par gyur pa rtsva mun dza dang / bal ba dza @147b lta bur mi drang ba /
translated: “Moreover, young man, when bodhisattvas see that sentient beings are disturbed, that they are not upright like the muñja grass or the bala tree,

translated: and that they turn their backs on the transcendence of suffering,

analyzed: de dag gi mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sgo dbye ba'i phyir chos bstan to //

translated: Thus the bodhisattvas’ great compassion extends to all sentient beings.

analyzed: gzhon nu / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi khams mthong na /
translated: “Prince, when bodhisattvas see the realm of sentient beings,

analyzed: rnam pa bcu po 'di dag gis snying rje chen po 'jug go / bsam pa las byung ba'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po de yang g-yo ba med par 'jug go /

analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa las shin tu byung ba'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po de yang mnyam par 'jug go /
translated: Because it arises from superior intention, their great compassion extends to them equally.

analyzed: lam las byung ba'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po de yang drang po bcos ma ma yin par 'jug go /
translated: Because it arises from the path, their great compassion extends to them straightforwardly and without pretense.

analyzed: sems gya gyu med pa'i sems las shin tu gnas pa las byung ba'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po de yang gya gyu med par 'jug go /
translated: Because it arises from a mind that is not crooked, their great compassion extends to them without crookedness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

analyzed: sems can thams cad la 'dud pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba las shin tu byung ba'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po de yang bdag gi bde ba gtong bar 'jug go / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: bdag gi sems yongs su dag pa las byung ba'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po de yang pha rol rjes su srung bar 'jug go / 'di lta ste / g-yo zhing 'gul ba'i sems dang bral ba rab tu gnas pa'i sems las byung ba'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po de yang shes @148a *//
translated: Because it arises from a mind that is completely pure, his great compassion engages in protecting others.

original: rab brtan par 'jug go /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab brtan par 'jug go / 'di lta ste /
translated: Because it arises from a mind that is free from the movement of a wavering mind and is well-established, his great compassion engages in firm knowledge.

original: pha rol la bde ba sbyin pa las rab tu byung ba'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po de yang bdag gi bde ba gtong bar 'jug go /
analyzed: pha rol la bde ba sbyin pa las rab tu byung ba'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po de yang bdag gi bde ba gtong bar 'jug go /
translated: Because it arises from giving happiness to others, his great compassion engages in giving up his own happiness.

original: brtson 'grus brtan pa las rab tu byung ba'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po de yang sems can thams cad kyi khur 'khyer bar 'jug ste /🔽gzhon nu / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtan pa las rab tu byung ba'i phyir de'i snying rje chen po de yang sems can thams cad kyi khur 'khyer bar 'jug ste / gzhon nu / 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po ni /
translated: Because he has gone forth through firm effort, his great compassion engages in carrying the burden of all sentient beings.

original: rnam pa 'di dag dang / gzhan yang rnam pa bcus 'jug go /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag dang / gzhan yang rnam pa bcus 'jug go /
translated: Prince, in this way, a bodhisattva’s great compassion engages in these aspects and also in ten other aspects.

original: gzhon nu / 'di ltar gang la la theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang snying rje chen pos 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhon nu / 'di ltar gang la la theg pa chen pos nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang snying rje chen pos 'byung ste /
translated: Prince, in this way, all those who are liberated by the Great Vehicle are liberated by great compassion.

original: de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‘great compassion.’

analyzed: sbyin pa byed pa dang / tshul khrims byed pa dang / bzod pa byed pa dang / brtson 'grus byed pa dang / bsam gtan byed pa dang / shes rab byed pa ni / snying rje chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The performance of generosity, the performance of ethical discipline, the performance of patience, the performance of effort, the performance of concentration, and the performance of wisdom🔽are called ‘great compassion.’

original: de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‘great compassion.’

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa byed pa dang / yang dag par spong ba byed pas snying rje chen po'o //
translated: It is great compassion because it is the practice of the applications of mindfulness and the practice of the authentic abandonings.

original: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / mchog tu dga' bar bya ba'i las dang / mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / tshig de dag thams cad kyang rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / mchog tu dga' bar bya ba'i las dang / mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / tshig de dag thams cad kyang rgyas par bya'o //
translated: It is the practice of the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, the path, the most delightful activities, the serial absorptions, the ten virtuous actions, and all those terms.

original: snying rje chen po ni /
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni /
translated: Great compassion is

original: de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “great compassion.”

analyzed: rang gi bya ba dang / legs @148b par byed pa'i bya ba dang / mi 'gyur ba'i bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la bya ba ci yod snyam pa ste /
translated: It is the activity of one’s own, the activity of what is well done, the activity of what is unchanging, and the activity of thinking, “What can I do for all sentient beings?”

analyzed: de'i snying rje chen po de yang sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed pas 'di ni /
translated: Since that great compassion of theirs is the fulfillment of the wishes of sentient beings, this is

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying rje chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the great compassion of the bodhisattva great being.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snying rje de dang ldan pas sems can 'di 'dra ba'i gnas thob pa mthong na /
translated: The bodhisattva great being who possesses this compassion, seeing that sentient beings have attained such a state,

analyzed: de dag la snying brtse ba dang / snying rje'i sems bskyed do //
translated: generates a mind of love and compassion for them.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ joy?

original: gang dge ba'i chos rnams dran pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / dga' ba dang / dad pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dge ba'i chos la mi zhum pa dang / mi 'god pa dang / yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
analyzed: gang dge ba'i chos rnams dran pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / dga' ba dang / dad pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dge ba'i chos la mi zhum pa dang / mi 'god pa dang / yongs su mi skyo ba dang /
translated: It is the recollection of virtuous qualities, the recollection of the subsequent recollection, joy, faith, delight, and the non-discouragement, non-exhaustion, and non-weariness with regard to virtuous qualities.

original: mi dga' ba thams cad spong ba dang / chos thams cad la dga' bar gnas pa dang / sems rab tu dga' ba dang / lus rab tu tshim pa dang / blo rab tu dga' ba dang / yid rab tu mgu ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mngon par dga' zhing mos pa dang /
analyzed: mi dga' ba thams cad spong ba dang / chos thams cad la dga' bar gnas pa dang / sems rab tu dga' ba dang / lus rab tu tshim pa dang / blo rab tu dga' ba dang / yid rab tu mgu ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la mngon par dga' zhing mos pa dang /
translated: It is to abandon all that is unpleasant. It is to delight in all phenomena. It is to have a joyful mind. It is to have a satisfied body. It is to have a joyful mind. It is to have a delighted mind. It is to delight in and be devoted to the body of the Thus-Gone One.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan kun tu tshol ba la dga' ba dang / chos nyan pas yongs su mi skyo zhing dga' ba dang / chos kyi phyir 'brang ba'i nan tan la rab tu dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba'i chos la mgu ba dang /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan kun tu tshol ba la dga' ba dang / chos nyan pas yongs su mi skyo zhing dga' ba dang / chos kyi phyir 'brang ba'i nan tan la rab tu dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba'i chos la mgu ba dang /
translated: It is to delight in seeking the adornments of the major and minor marks. It is to delight in listening to the Dharma without ever being discouraged. It is to delight in the practice of following the Dharma. It is to delight in the Dharma of complete joy.

original: sems can rnams la khong khro ba med pa dang / byang chub la dga' ba dang / chos rgya chen po la mos pa dang / nyi tshe ba'i @149a *//
analyzed: sems can rnams la khong khro ba med pa dang / byang chub la dga' ba dang / chos rgya chen po la mos pa dang / nyi tshe ba'i @149a *//
translated: It is to be free of anger toward beings. It is to delight in awakening. It is to be devoted to the vast Dharma. It is to be free of the limited view of the aggregates.

original: theg pa sel bar sems bskyed pa dang / ser sna tshar gcod pa dang / slong ba la dga' ba dang / gtong ba la rab tu dga' ba dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba dag sdud cing byams pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa la rtag tu dad pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa sel bar sems bskyed pa dang / ser sna tshar gcod pa dang / slong ba la dga' ba dang / gtong ba la rab tu dga' ba dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba dag sdud cing byams pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa la rtag tu dad pa dang /
translated: It is to generate the mind that is intent on eliminating the vehicles. It is to be victorious over stinginess. It is to delight in giving. It is to delight in generosity. It is to gather and love those with incorrect conduct. It is to always have faith in those with correct conduct.

original: bdag gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pas ngan 'gro dang / 'jigs pa thams cad las rab tu 'da' bar dbugs 'byin pa la rab tu dga' ba dang / pha rol ngan du zer ba dang / ngan par brjod pa'i tshig gi lam bzod cing rab tu dga' ba dang /
analyzed: bdag gi tshul khrims yongs su dag pas ngan 'gro dang / 'jigs pa thams cad las rab tu 'da' bar dbugs 'byin pa la rab tu dga' ba dang / pha rol ngan du zer ba dang / ngan par brjod pa'i tshig gi lam bzod cing rab tu dga' ba dang /
translated: It is to delight in the relief that comes from one’s own pure conduct, which transcends all the fears of the lower realms. It is to delight in the patience that comes from enduring the unpleasant words and speech of others.

original: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang / mgo bcad kyang bzod par nus te /
analyzed: lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / mig dang / mgo bcad kyang bzod par nus te /
translated: It is to be able to endure having one’s hands, feet, eyes, and head cut off.

original: sems mi nyams shing rab tu dga' ba dang / rgan rabs la 'dud cing zhes byed pa la dga' ba dang / rtag tu bzhin 'dzum pa la dga' ba dang / khro gnyer med cing gsong por smra ba la dga' ba dang / tshul 'chos pa dang /
analyzed: sems mi nyams shing rab tu dga' ba dang / rgan rabs la 'dud cing zhes byed pa la dga' ba dang / rtag tu bzhin 'dzum pa la dga' ba dang / khro gnyer med cing gsong por smra ba la dga' ba dang / tshul 'chos pa dang /
translated: They are to delight in not letting their minds deteriorate, in being respectful to the elders, in being polite, in always having a smiling face, in being free of frowns, in being open and honest, in being free of hypocrisy,

original: kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong med pa la rab tu dga' ba dang / snying po dang ldan pa'i chos 'jug par rab tu dga' ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la ston pa bzhin du phangs pa dang / chos la bdag bzhin du phangs pa dang /
analyzed: kha gsag dang / gzhogs slong med pa la rab tu dga' ba dang / snying po dang ldan pa'i chos 'jug par rab tu dga' ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' la ston pa bzhin du phangs pa dang / chos la bdag bzhin du phangs pa dang /
translated: in being free of flattery and innuendo, in delighting in the teachings that are meaningful, in cherishing the bodhisattvas as much as a teacher, in cherishing the Dharma as much as one’s own life,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la srog bzhin du phangs pa dang / bla ma la pha ma bzhin du phangs pa dang / sems can thams cad la bu bzhin du phangs pa dang / slob dpon la mig bzhin du phangs pa dang / nan tan la yan lag gi dam pa bgo @149b bzhin du phangs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la srog bzhin du phangs pa dang / bla ma la pha ma bzhin du phangs pa dang / sems can thams cad la bu bzhin du phangs pa dang / slob dpon la mig bzhin du phangs pa dang / nan tan la yan lag gi dam pa bgo @149b bzhin du phangs pa dang /
translated: in cherishing the thus-gone ones as much as one’s own life, in cherishing the gurus as much as one’s own parents, in cherishing all beings as much as one’s own children, in cherishing the masters as much as one’s own eyes, and in cherishing one’s practice as much as one’s own head.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la lag pa dang / rkang pa bzhin du phangs pa dang / chos smra ba la rin po che thams cad bzhin du phangs pa dang / chos yongs su tshol ba la sman bzhin du phangs pa dang / bskul zhing dran par byed pa la sman pa bzhin du phangs par sems dpa'o //🔽gzhon nu / 'di ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la lag pa dang / rkang pa bzhin du phangs pa dang / chos smra ba la rin po che thams cad bzhin du phangs pa dang / chos yongs su tshol ba la sman bzhin du phangs pa dang / bskul zhing dran par byed pa la sman pa bzhin du phangs par sems dpa'o // gzhon nu / 'di ni /
translated: He cherishes the perfections as much as his own hands and feet, cherishes the Dharma teachers as much as all jewels, cherishes the search for the Dharma as much as medicine, and cherishes those who exhort and remind him as much as a physician.🔽Prince, this is called

original: dga' ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ste /
translated: joy.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dga' ba de la rab tu gnas nas rtag tu chos tshol ba la dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dga' ba de la rab tu gnas nas rtag tu chos tshol ba la dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva, dwelling in this joy, always delights in seeking the Dharma

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa la mi skyo'o //
translated: and does not tire of practicing bodhisattva conduct.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi btang snyoms gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ equanimity?

original: btang snyoms rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of equanimity:

original: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three kinds?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

translated: 1. equanimity with regard to the afflictions, 2. equanimity in protecting oneself and others, and 3. equanimity with regard to time and season.

analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i btang snyoms pa gang zhe na / gang bkur sti byas kyang mthor mi sems pa dang / bkur sti ma byas kyang dma' bar mi sems pa dang / rnyed pas snyems pa med pa dang / ma rnyed bas yi mi chad pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang tshul khrims 'chal bal glo mnyam pa dang / grags pa la dka' ba med pa dang / ma grags pa la zhum pa med pa dang / smad pa la yid mi bzod pa dang / bstod pa la chos nyid du shin tu gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal la so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang /

original: rtog pa'i stobs dang / rjes su chags pa 'dor ba dang / khong khro ba spong ba dang / mja'  ba dang mi mdza' ba la sems mnyam pa dang / legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa la gnyis su mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa'i stobs dang / rjes su chags pa 'dor ba dang / khong khro ba spong ba dang / mja'  ba dang mi mdza' ba la sems mnyam pa dang / legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa la gnyis su mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is to have the power of realization. It is to abandon attachment. It is to relinquish anger. It is to have an impartial mind toward friends and foes. It is to not discriminate between good and bad.

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug ba la mi lta ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa dang bsnyen bkur mi byed pa la dga' ba dang / mi dga' bar bya ba med pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / mi snyan par smra ba la rjes su chags pa dang /

translated: It is to not look at what is attractive or unattractive. It is to be neither pleased nor displeased by those who serve or do not serve. It is to not speak pleasantly or unpleasantly.

original: khong khro ba med pa dang / kun myang ba'i nyes pa la mtshungs par yongs su 'jal ba dang / bdag dang sems can gzhan la bsam pa mnyam pa dang / lus dang srog la mi lta ba dang / sems can rab 'bring tha ma la 'od zer mnyam pa dang /

translated: It is to be neither attached nor angry. It is to be impartial toward the faults of others. It is to have the same attitude toward oneself and others. It is to not care for one’s body or life. It is to have the same light for all sentient beings, whether they are of the highest, middling, or lowest capacity.

translated: By giving wealth, grain, treasuries, and storehouses, one attains the perfection of the complete accomplishment of the treasury of all precious teachings.

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
